content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the gang is there except for Rachel and Ross, who both come storming in. Rachel is still going off about Ross’s secret marriage.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I cannot believe that you didn’t tell me that we are still married!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look I was going to tell you!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: When?! After the birth of our first secret child?! (To All) Ross didn’t get the annulment; we are still married.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re kidding!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, maybe it wasn’t my best decision. But I just couldn’t face another failed marriage.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, let me just jump in and ask, at what point did you think this was a successful marriage?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, come on, if you think about it, it’s actually kinda funny. (He laughs, and he laughs alone.) Okay, maybe it’s best not to think about it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, this is inexcusable. I am shocked to my very core!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, I told her you already knew.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Another lie. You have a sickness!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ross, just for my own piece of mind, you’re not married to anymore of us are ya?

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Monica are at the counter getting some more coffee.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Hey, somebody left their keys. (Looks at them) Ooohh, to a Porsche! {Transcriber’s note: Oh come on! Who would leave the keys to their Porsche behind? If I had a Porsche, I’d have the keys surgically attached to my hand!} Hey Gunther, these yours?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Yeah, that’s what I drive. I make four bucks an hour, I saved up for 350 years!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Na-uh! (To everyone there) Hey did anybody lose their keys?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, why don’t you put them in the lost and found?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s a lost and found? (Gunther sets the box up on the table.) My shoe! (Grabs it out of the box.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You left a shoe here?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I didn’t realize until I got home. I wasn’t gonna walk all the way back down here with one shoe! Y’know what? I’m gonna go find that guy’s car and leave a note on the windshield. (Goes to do so.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh good, when he comes back for his keys, I’ll be sure to give him your shoe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! Thanks. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, good, good, you guys are here! Listen, how would like to spend tomorrow taking care of three incredibly cute little puppies?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, what a fun day! That sounds great!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, all right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, well I’ll bring them by tomorrow morning. Okay, and uh, by the way, they’re not actually puppies, they’re Frank and Alice’s triplets. Okay, see ya! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa! What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Please! Please! Please! Please! Oh please! Please! Please! Frank and Alice asked me to baby sit the triplets and I’m nervous ‘cause I’ve never done that before by myself!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t worry about it Phoebe, we’ll absolutely do it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I’m gonna pass. ‘Cause I was kinda iffy when it was puppies.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on Chandler, come on! It’ll give us great practice for when—(realizes what she’s about to say and changes)—people with babies come to visit.

content.description: The street down the block from Central Perk, Joey has found the Porsche and is writing the note.

content.speaker: Guy #1
content.text: Nice car!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it’s not mine.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I love your car.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, it’s (looks up and sees the woman) mine.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: I bet it’s fast.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too! Yeah. And comfortable. Do uh, do you like leather seats?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s got ‘em!
content.parenthetical: checks in the window to make sure it has them

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe and Rachel are having tea.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, I still have boxes here. I still have boxes at Ross’s, and I have nowhere to live! Wow. I could so easily freak out right now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What about me? I just found out that Denise is leaving town for a while, I don’t have a roommate.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, maybe-maybe I could be your roommate Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe you could be my roommate!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well there’s an idea!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That would be great! Wait, how long is Denise gone for?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, she said she’d be back December 26 th .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: December 26 th , huh maybe she’s Santa Clause.
(Phoebe laughs, then stops to think about it. Ross enters.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh look who it is, my husband. The apple of my eye.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I got us a court date for tomorrow at 2:00 and I picked up all the forms. I’ll take care of everything.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well sure, if you say you’re gonna take care of everything I have no reason to doubt you. Give me those forms! (Grabs them from him.) All right, now I’m gonna do this my way and I don’t want to hear a peep out of you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay Rach, but…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Op! You’re peeping!
(Ross grunts something and hands her the pen he was trying to hand her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Y’know what, I just got—why? Why did you do this?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look I told you…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t wanna hear “Three failed marriages!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, if you’d had two failed marriages, you’d understand!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know what? Thanks to you I’m half way there! Ugh! Oh! I am so mad! Ross, I don’t think I have ever been this angry!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What about the time I said we were on a break?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! (Stares at him.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next day, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are baby-sitting the triplets. They each have one baby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pheebs, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m doing okay. I think it’s going well. Do you think they’re having fun? Am I talking to fast?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nope, sound like me. Pheebs, it’s going great. Look at Chandler with little baby girl Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Little baby girl Chandler, where I have heard that before? Oh right, Coach Ruben. (Tries to get her to drink a little more from the bottle when he suddenly smells something. It’s times like these I’m glad Smell-O-Vision hasn’t been invented.) Do you know what Pheebs? When you’re done over there, we kinda have a situation over here too. (Phoebe is changing hers.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Na-uh, no, we are all responsible for our own babies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See that’s where I think that you’re wrong. We’ve been playing these babies man for man; we should really be playing a zone defense.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I just think that things would go a lot smoother if we each have our own zone. Phoebe, you can be in charge of wiping. And y’know Mon, you can be in charge of diapering and I can be in charge of looking how cute they are when they put their hands around… (He degrades into baby talk, but he means when they grab his finger.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That sounds really great, but maybe you should be in charge of wiping.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I’m a rookie. I should not be in the end zone.
[Time lapse, they have set up a little assembly line for diaper changes. Phoebe wipes, Chandler adds the powder, begrudgingly, and Monica puts the diaper on.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so great! This is exactly how we set the plates at the restaurant.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah? (Checking the final diaper) Well this is not what I ordered.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey babies! Oh, I’m having the best morning. That uh, that Porsche I’ve got the keys too, still there!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Shocking! Since you still have the keys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You should see the treatment I get when I’m with that car! People are friendly; they-they wanna talk, and not just about the car! One guy gave me advice about my equity investments.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What equity investments?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The ones that got me the Porsche! Will you keep up! (Chandler wipes his forehead with a baby wipe, that might have been used. He drops it disgustedly.) But I figured, if-if people keep seeing me just standing there, they’re gonna start to think that I don’t own it. So I figured I’ll wash it. Right? Monica, you got a bucket and some soap I can borrow?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, I got soap and sponges and rags and Carnuba wax and polishing compound.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t even have a car!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. But umm, one time there was this really dirty car in front of the building, so I washed it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And six others.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There you are.

content.description: The Porsche, Joey is finishing up washing the car and is talking to a guy about the car.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, she tops out at 130.

content.speaker: Guy #2
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And that’s just in the city. I get her up to 160 when I take her upstate.

content.speaker: Guy #2
content.text: Really! You got a place upstate?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Guy #2
content.text: Well, I’ll see you later.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, take it easy.

content.speaker: The Porsche Owner
content.text: Hey! That’s my car.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? Oh uh, oh just give me five more minutes with it.

content.speaker: The Porsche Owner
content.text: What-what are you doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh I-I uh, found the keys and now I’m just polishing her up.

content.speaker: The Porsche Owner
content.text: But it’s my car!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but it’s my wax.

content.speaker: The Porsche Owner
content.text: Listen, I-I-I don’t come to this city much so I don’t know if you’re crazy or this is some kind of street theater, but could I have my keys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure. Here. (He hands them over.) I’ll uh, save your parking spot.

content.speaker: The Porsche Owner
content.text: I’m not coming back.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: The Porsche Owner
content.text: I live upstate.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, so did I.
(The guy gets in and drives off.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the triplets are all in their crib as Monica and Phoebe watch them.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know why I was so nervous about this. And I don’t know why Frank and Alice are always complaining. This is so easy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, two hours, a lifetime that’s the same.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Check it out! Check it out! When the babies wake up, they can meet Krog! (He holds up this Xena-like warrior action figure.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, what are you doing? That thing can put someone’s eye out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He can do more than that! He can destroy the universe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No Chandler, they can swallow one of those little parts! And also, look at his smooth area, that’s just gonna mess them up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They’re not gonna swallow anything, you guys are being way over protective. When I was a kid, my mom used to just throw me into a pile of broken glass!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Glass, sand, whatever. (Walks out as Monica and Phoebe turn to check on the babies again.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look at little Leslie stretching in her sleep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh it’s so cute. I wonder what age it is when you stop being able to put both legs over your head.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I can still do that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How are you still single?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. (Clears throat) I thought about it and maybe you’re right. Maybe Krog is not a safe toy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good. What made you change your mind?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I swallowed the sonic blaster gun.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How did that happen?!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I was trying to prove that I was right. Y’know? And it turns out I was wrong. And now it’s lodged in my throat. (Mimics a cat trying to cough up a hairball.) (He does it again.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Damnit! Y’know this whole time we were concentrating on watching the babies and, and no one was watching Chandler! (He does it again.)

content.description: A judge’s chambers, Rachel and Ross are filing their annulment papers.

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: Okay you two are asking the court for an annulment?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes your honor, and here are, are forms, all filled out.

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: So based on your petition you are seeking an annulment on the grounds that Mr. Geller is mentally unstable.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fine, I’m mentally unstable.

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: And based on the fact that Mr. Geller is intravenous drug user.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh yes, heroin and crack.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Crack isn’t even an intravenous drug!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you would know.

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: Now it also says here that you lied about your sexual preference before marriage?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, come on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, please, I found the magazines!

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: And finally that you were unable to consummate the marriage. Well, that makes sense since you’re gay and addicted to heroin.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’m sorry, this is insane! I-I-I’m not addicted to heroin, I’m not gay, and there is no problem with my ability to consummate anything! Look, I’ll consummate this marriage right here, right now!

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: That won’t be necessary.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And when we were dating we consummated like bunnies!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: Now if you were two involved in a serious relationship, that really creates a problem.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Your honor, rest assured relationship ended like two years ago! (To the stenographer) And could you strike “Consummated like bunnies” from the record?

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: Is there, anything in this record that is actually true?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, yes, we got married in Vegas and uh, and the names I think.

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: Well, based on what I heard, you two certainly don’t qualify for an annulment. If you two don’t want to be together you’ll have to file for divorce.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s great! Are you happy now? Look what you did with your funny, funny form!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Me?! What about you and your consummated like bunnies nonsense!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And what—(notices the stenographer is still typing)—What are you typing that for? Did you hear what she said? We don’t get the annulment. Don’t type that! What?! Stop typing! (He goes over to where the stenographer is typing and in the process pushes Rachel out of his way.) Hey! Stop typing! (He’s still typing.) Stop typing! Stop typing!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, do you see, do you see what you’re keeping me married too?!

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: You need to get out of my chambers.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right look lady here is the deal, I came here for an annulment and I am not leaving here until I get one!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Judge
content.text: Would you like to spend the night in jail?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And thank you for your time. (They both beat a hasty retreat.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is still doing the hairball thing as Monica and Phoebe are watching the babies. I can’t describe it, you’ll have to see it when it comes on in your area.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So the Porsche guy took his car back.
content.parenthetical: entering wearing nothing but Porsche clothes

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But you found the keys to his clothes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. No, I just uh, I just loved the way it feels when everybody thinks I own a Porsche.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And people will think you own a Porsche because you’re wearing the clothes?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Of course! Only an idiot would wear this stuff if you didn’t have the car! Right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That is true.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but only a genius would swallow a sonic blaster gun.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’ve been there. Yeah, I am gonna go drive my Porsche. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, you know you don’t actually have one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! What are you doing?! I’m in character! Would you talk to her! (Storms out.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, I think it just moved. It’s really poking me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, that’s it, we’re going to the emergency room.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! No, you can’t, you can’t leave me here with them! We’re baby-sitting!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The babies are asleep, I’m sure you’ll be okay on your own for a while!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But you-you can’t leave me with them! We-we’re a team! We’re playing a zone! They’re gonna triple team me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s got something plastic lodged in his throat, we’ve got to go to the hospital.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But no, because a doctor won’t be able to help him, it’s just gonna y’know naturally pass through his system in like seven years.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think that’s gum.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m pretty sure it’s gun.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, listen this really hurts. Let’s go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A real man wouldn’t just run to the hospital! (They don’t stop.) No! What would, what would Krog do? (They ignore her and Phoebe is left alone.)

content.description: The street, Joey is hanging out wearing his Porsche grab.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why isn’t that valet back with my Porsche?

content.speaker: Passerby
content.text: Maybe because you’ve got the keys?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Porsche.
(Ross and Rachel approach, they’re still yelling at each other.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is totally your fault!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My fault?! You threatened the judge!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you ripped the paper out of the court reporter’s machine!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was the only way I could get him to stop typing !

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi! How are the Gellers?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t call us that! (Storms away)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The judge wouldn’t let us get an annulment! Now we gotta get a divorce!! Did a Porsch throw up on you? (Walks on.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! It’s Porsche!! (He’s right y’know.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is being triple teamed.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me taking care of you is no problem, huh? You guys feel safe. Right? Okay, I’m gonna take that spit bubble as, “Yeah, I do!” Okay, after I get rid of this dirty diaper Leslie, I’ll set you up with a clean one. (She throws it at the garbage without looking, misses, and knocks over a vase and flowers, which fall to the floor and break.) Okay, I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to scare you. I just have to clean that up. Okay? ‘Cause let’s face it, we’re at Monica’s. (She crawls over, disposes of the diaper, picks up the flowers, and the vase.) I broke it. All right. Well, that’s just the way that goes. (She throws out both the flowers and the vase.) Okay, good. (She turns around and only counts two babies.) Why are there only two of you? Where is Leslie? Well, you can’t answer. (She starts looking for her) Leslie? Where are you Leslie? Leslie, now would be a good time for your first words! (She turns around and finds that Leslie has managed to crawl into the bottom drawer of the TV cabinet.) Well, look at you! Hey! You are a little bit mischievous! My gosh! (She picks her up and notices a surprise is waiting in the drawer.) Oh, you’re a lot mischievous! Well, it’ll dry. (Closes the drawer with her foot.) (To Leslie) Okay, you sit with your brother and sister now—who aren’t there! (They both have disappeared as well.)

[Time Lapse, the babies are finally asleep. Good for Phoebe! The only problem is, Monica’s apartment looks like a tornado, a hurricane, a swarm of locusts, fire, brimstone, hail, and giant man-eating, radioactive ants have torn the place apart. Needless to say, it’s messy enough to cause Monica to die of shock right away. Parents with small children know what I’m talking about.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How do you feel?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, let’s just say that Krog will be fully equipped to destroy the universe again in twelve to fourteen hours.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, so I totally took care of the babies all by myself! I fed ‘em, bathed ‘em, and put ‘em to bed.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And protected them from a tornado?
(Monica enters and her jaw drops in horror.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, the babies are asleep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, what, what happened here?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I did it! I took care of the babies all by myself!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But my apartment!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Was the setting of Phoebe’s triumph.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But the mess!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is not as important as the fact that Phoebe took care of the babies all by herself.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re right, you’re right I shouldn’t freak out. ‘Cause this is what will happen when you and I have babies! When will that be?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Phoebe, would you take a look at this mess!!!!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Rachel is packing what she still has over there as Ross enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey thank God you’re home, I was getting worried.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I picked up the divorce papers. Uh, I’ve already signed everything and I put little ‘X’s where you need to sign.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, little ‘X’s! Great! That makes up for everything!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, I-I—you’ve done a lot of stupid stuff too! Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, name one stupid thing that is as stupid as this one!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, how about you flew to London to stop my wedding! Ah, how about you told me you loved me after I was already married!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Wait a minute! That was different! I did those things because I was in love with you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Right!
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re right. That’s very different. So let’s, let’s just sign the papers. All right? (Sits down and Rachel keeps standing there.) What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nothing. (Sits down.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, can we just sign please?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-hmm. (Just as Rachel finishes signing her name, Ross yanks each page out of the way.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Congratulations. (Gets up to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Ross, we’re—wait a minute. Umm, I uh, I kinda have a little confession.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, y’know this whole marriage thing, kinda my idea.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, remember how we were too drunk to remember anything the night we were married?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And uh, yeah, I didn’t really, I didn’t want to say anything, but it kinda it just, it kinda kept coming back to me, and umm, remember we were in the casino and for some reason thought it would be funny to eat a lot of grapes. And uh, and I thought it would be funnier if we got married. So as a, as a compromise we decided first to get married, and then (Ross joins in) to eat a lot of grapes. So umm, sorry I got us into this mess.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So then if-if—I mean if you think about it, this is all (Pause.) your fault.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, don’t push it though.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve got to say; I know I divorce a lot of women, never thought I would be divorcing you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. I always thought if you and I got married, it would be the one that stuck. And it wouldn’t be a secret, and we wouldn’t have our wedding dinner at Pizza Hut . (They both laugh.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did I, did I even treat?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, it was on the house, it was, it was a newlywed special.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That may be the most depressing thing I’ve heard in my life. I should probably get these to my lawyer’s office.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, thanks Ross, for taking care of all of this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Eh, no problem.
(They hug.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m gonna need a copy of those.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Totally. (Exits.)

content.description: The street, Joey is messing with a car cover and still wearing the Porsche stuff. This guy playing street football catches a pass next to the car cover Joey is fooling around with.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Hey! Be careful around my Porsche!

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi Joey.
content.parenthetical: the same one from before approaches

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! How you doin’?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: He has the most amazing Porsche under there!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’d love to show ya, but I just tucked her in. She’s sleeping. (The women both laugh) Hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink? (Just then the same guy with the football dives to make a catch, lands on the car cover, and collapses it. It turns out that Joey set up a bunch of boxes to make it look like a Porsche.)
